availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Keagan (Louisville, Kentucky, street paver and contractor)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, street paver and contractor. Native of Ireland. Married to Ann Keagan. Father of Julia Keagan, Mathew Keagan, Mary Keagan, Elizabeth Keagan. Street paver in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owner of one enslaved person in Louisville in 1850. Resident in Louisville in 1860. Contractor in Louisville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, 418 County, 8th Ward of Louisville, p. 418B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, 8th Ward of Louisville, p. 806.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 6, p. 303.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport (before 1911), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Film 7007126, Jefferson County Deaths, p. 37.
